guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for propafenone and CYP2D6

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302705

text.html:
It is not possible to offer adequately substantiated recommendations for dose adjustment based on the literature.

  • Either monitor plasma concentrations, perform an ECG and be alert to reduced efficacy of the therapy.
  • Or choose an alternative. Antiarrhythmic drugs that are hardly if at all metabolised by CYP2D6 include, for example, sotalol, disopyramide, quinidine and amiodarone.

implications: Genetic variation decreases the sum of the plasma concentrations of propafenone and the active metabolite 5-hydroxypropafenone. This increases the risk of reduced or no efficacy.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302691

text.html:
It is not possible to offer adequately substantiated recommendations for dose adjustment based on the literature.

  • Either guide the dose by therapeutic drug monitoring, perform an ECG and be alert to side effects.
  • Or choose an alternative. Antiarrhythmic drugs that are hardly if at all metabolised by CYP2D6 include, for example, sotalol, disopyramide, quinidine and amiodarone.

implications: Genetic variation increases the sum of the plasma concentrations of propafenone and the active metabolite 5-hydroxypropafenone. This may increase the risk of side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302695

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for propafenone in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on propafenone.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302699

  • Or choose an alternative. Antiarrhythmic drugs that are hardly if at all metabolised by CYP2D6 include, for example, sotalol, disopyramide, quinidine and amiodarone.

implications: Genetic variation decreases the sum of the plasma concentrations of propafenone and the active metabolite 5-hydroxypropafenone. This increases the risk of reduced or no efficacy.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166302690

text.html: Reduce the dose to 30% of the standard dose, perform an ECG and monitor plasma concentrations.

implications: Genetic variation increases the sum of the plasma concentrations of propafenone and the active metabolite 5-hydroxypropafenone. This increases the risk of side effects.
